description.p: When you hit a target with a weapon attack, you can expend an Exploit Die to cripple one of its senses. It must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or it takes additional damage equal to one roll of your Exploit Die and is blinded, deafened, or cannot speak (your choice) until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: When you hit a target with a weapon attack, expend one Exploit Die to force it to make a Constitution saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}); if it fails, it takes 1d{{exploit dice:size}} additional damage and is blinded, deafened, or cannot speak (your choice) until your next turn.

description.p: As a bonus action, you can expend an Exploit Die to enter a defensive stance that lasts until the start of your next turn. Each time a creature you can see targets you with an attack while you are in this stance, you gain a bonus to your Armor Class against that attack equal to a roll of your Exploit Die.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die to enter a defensive stance until your next turn; each time a creature you can see attacks you during the stance, you gain +1d{{exploit dice:size}} to your AC.

description.p: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend an Exploit Die to strike at a vulnerable area. It must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or it takes additional damage equal to a roll of your Exploit Die, falls prone, and it cannot take reactions until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, expend one Exploit Die to force it to make a Constitution saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}); if it fails, it takes 1d{{exploit dice:size}} additional damage, falls prone, and is unable to take reaction until your next turn.

description.p: Whenever you are forced to make an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw you can expend an Exploit Die, roll it, and add the result to your saving throw. You can do so after you roll the d20, but before you know if you succeed or fail.

sheet.description: When you are forced to make an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, expend one Exploit Die to add 1d{{exploit dice:size}} to the roll (after rolling but before knowing if it will succeed).

description.p: As a bonus action, you can expend an Exploit Die and shout a challenge at a foe. One creature of your choice within 30 feet that can see or hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on all attack rolls it makes against targets other than you for 1 minute.
The creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. This effect ends early if you attack a creature other than the target.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die to force a creature within 30 ft. that can see or hear you to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}); if it fails, it has disadvantage on all attack rolls against targets other than you for 1 minute. It can repeat this saving throw at the end of each turn, ending the effect on a success; the effect also ends if you attack a creature other than it.

description.p: As part of a weapon attack you can expend an Exploit Die to grant yourself advantage on your attack roll. You can use this Exploit after you roll, but before you know if you hit or miss.

sheet.description: As part of a weapon attack, expend one Exploit Die to gain advantage on the attack roll (after the roll but before it is declared a hit or miss).

description.p: As a bonus action, you can expend one Exploit Die and force one creature within 30 feet that can see or hear you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is frightened of you until the end of your next turn and must use its action to move as far away from you as possible without harming itself.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die to force a creature within 30 ft. that can see or hear you to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}); if it fails, it is frightened until your next turn and must use its action to move as far away from you as possible without harming itself.

description.p: When a creature you can see misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to expend an Exploit Die and force it to attack another creature of your choice within range of its attack, adding one roll of your Exploit Die to its attack roll.

sheet.description: When a creature you can see misses you with a melee attack, expend one Exploit Die to force it to attack another creature of your choice within range, adding 1d{{exploit dice:size}} to its attack roll.

description.p: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend an Exploit Die to rend its armor. It must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or it takes additional damage equal to one roll of your Exploit Die and its Armor Class is reduced by 1 until the damage is repaired, or it finishes a long rest.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a melee attack, expend one Exploit Die to rend its armor and force it to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}); if it fails, it takes 1d{{exploit dice:size}} additional damage and its AC is reduced by 1 until it repairs its armor or finishes a long rest.

description.p: As an action, you can expend one Exploit Die to fire a volley of ammunition at a point you can see within normal range of your weapon. Creatures of your choice within 5 feet of that point must make a Dexterity Saving throw. On a failure, they take piercing damage equal to one roll of your Exploit Die + your Dexterity modifier, and half as much on a success.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die to force creatures of your choice within 5 ft. of a chosen point within your weapon's range to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}); if they fail, they take 1d{{exploit dice:size}} + {{dexterity:modifier}} piercing damage, and half of that on a success.

description.p: In place of an attack, you can expend an Exploit Die to force each target within reach of a melee weapon you are wielding to make a Dexterity saving throw. Targets take damage equal to a roll of your Exploit Die + your Strength or Dexterity modifier on a failed save, and half as much on a success.

sheet.description: In place of an attack, expend one Exploit Die to force each target within reach of a melee weapon you are wielding to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}); if they fail, they take 1d{{exploit dice:size}} + {{whirlwind strike mod}} damage, and half of that on a success.

description.p: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend an Exploit Die to temporarily weaken it. The first attack made against that creature before the beginning of your next turn has advantage, and on hit, that attack deals additional damage equal to one roll of your Exploit Die.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, expend one Exploit Die to weaken it; the first attack made against it before you next turn has advantage and deals 1d{{exploit dice:size}} additional damage.

description.p: When you make a melee weapon attack and miss, you can expend an Exploit Die to immediately repeat your attack against another target within the reach of your weapon.

sheet.description: When you make a melee attack and miss, expend one Exploit Die to repeat the attack against another attack in your weapon's reach.

description.p: As a bonus action, you can expend an Exploit Die to form your allies into a defensive position. You and allied creatures within 10 feet that are wielding a weapon or shield gain the benefits of half cover, which also apply to ability checks and saving throws made to avoid being moved against your will.
The benefits of this Exploit instantly end if you leave your space, and they have no effect on incapacitated creatures.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die to grant yourself and allied creatures within 10 ft. that are wielding a weapon or shield the benefits of half cover; this also applies to ability checks and saving throws made to avoid being moved unwillingly. The benefits end if you leave your space and do not apply to incapacitated creatures.

description.p: As a bonus action, you can expend an Exploit Die to enter an immovable stance that lasts until you move from the space. Each time a creature attempts to grapple, move you against your will, or move through your space while you are in this stance it must first succeed on a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you can instantly grapple it or knock it prone.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die to enter a stance that lasts until you move from your space. Each time a creature attempts to grapple or move you against you will, or move through your space, it must first succeed on a DC {{exploit dice:save}} Strength saving throw; if it fails, you can instantly grapple it or knock it prone.

description.p: When you make an ability check that doesn't include your proficiency bonus, you can expend an Exploit Die and add it to your roll. You can use this Exploit after you roll, but before you know if you succeed or fail.

sheet.description: When you make an ability check without a proficiency bonus, expend one Exploit Die to add it (after rolling but before knowing if it will succeed).

description.p: As a bonus action, you can expend an Exploit Die to shout a one-word command at one creature that can hear you within 30 feet. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it is compelled to obey your command to the best of its ability on its next turn unless its actions would be directly harmful to it.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die to force a creature that can hear you within 30 ft. to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}; if it fails, it must obey a one-word command from you to the best of its ability on its next turn unless it would directly harm itself with it.

description.p: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend an Exploit Die to send it reeling. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or it must subtract 1d4 from all ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws it makes for 1 minute.
A creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, expend one Exploit Die to force it to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}; if it fails, subtract 1d4 from all ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws it makes for 1 minute.

description.p: In place of an attack, you can expend an Exploit Die to strike the ground at your feet with a melee weapon. All creatures within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take bludgeoning damage equal to one roll of your Exploit Die + your Strength modifier and fall prone. On a successful save, they take half as much damage and don't fall prone.
Terrain in this area that is loose earth or stone becomes difficult terrain until a creature uses its action to clear it.

sheet.description: In place of an attack, expend one Exploit Die to force all creatures within 5 ft. to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}; if they fail, they take 1d{{exploit dice:size}} + {{strength:modifier}} bludgeoning damage and fall prone, or half this without falling prone on a success.

description.p: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend an Exploit Die to empower your attack with immense force. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take additional damage equal to a roll of your Exploit Die and be knocked back in a straight line number of feet equal to 5 times your Strength modifier. Creatures more than one size larger than you have advantage on their saving throw.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, expend an Exploit Die to force it to make a Strength saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}); if it fails, it takes 1d{{exploit dice:size}} additional damage and is knocked back {{thunderous blow knockback}} in a line; targets more than one size larger than you have advantage on the saving throw.

description.p: As a bonus action, you can expend an Exploit Die to make a special ranged weapon attack with a weapon that has both the finesse and thrown properties.

This attack ignores the benefits of cover, so long as it can ricochet off one surface and hit a target in range. If this attack would normally have disadvantage, it does not, and on hit, it deals additional damage equal to one roll of your Exploit Die.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die to make a ranged weapon attack with a weapon that has both the finesse and thrown properties; it ignores the benefits of cover as long as it can richocet off a surface to hit a target in range. If this attack would normally have disadvantage, it would not, and it deals an additional 1d{{exploit dice:size}} damage on hit.

description.p: As an action, you can expend an Exploit Die and flourish your melee weapon instantly move up to 30 feet in a straight line, without provoking attacks of opportunity. Any creatures that you pass through must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take damage equal to two rolls of your Exploit Die + either your Strength or Dexterity modifier.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die to instantly move up to 30 ft. in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks. Any creatures you pass through must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}); if they fail, they takes 2d{{exploit dice:size}} + {{zephyr slash damage}} damage.

description.p: When another creature that can see or hear you within 30 feet scores a critical hit, you can use your reaction to expend Exploit Dice (up to your proficiency bonus), roll those dice, and grant that creature a number of temporary hit points equal to the total you rolled + your Leadership modifier.
Temporary hit points from this Exploit last for 1 minute and are instantly dispelled if the creature is incapacitated.

sheet.description: When another creature you can see or hear within 30 ft. scores a critical, hit expend up to {{proficiency}} Exploit Dice and roll them to grant that creature that many + an additional {{leadership:modifier}} temporary hit points; these last for 1 minute or until the creature is incapacitated.

description.p: When you take the Attack action, you can issue this Order in place of an attack, targeting another creature that can see or hear you within 30 feet. Until the beginning of your next turn, the creature's speed increases by a number of feet equal to 5 times your Leadership modifier (minimum of 5 feet), its long and high jump distances are doubled, and it has advantage on all Dexterity (Acrobatics) and Strength (Athletics) checks.

sheet.description: In place of an attack during your Attack action, grant another creature that can see or hear you within 30 ft., until your next turn, an additional {{enlivening order movement}} ft. of speed, doubled long and high jump distances, and advantage on all Dexterity (Acrobatics) and Strength (Athletics) checks.

description.p: When you take the Attack action, you can issue this Order in place of an attack, targeting another creature that can see or hear you within 30 feet. That creature can instantly repeat a saving throw to end one condition currently affecting it.

sheet.description: In place of an attack during your Attack action, grant another creature that can see or hear you within 30 ft. the ability to instantly repeat a saving throw to end one condition currently afflicting it.

description.p: When you take the Attack action, you can issue this Order in place of an attack, targeting another creature that can see or hear you within 30 feet. Until the start of your next turn, that creature adds your Leadership modifier (minimum of +1) to all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

sheet.description: In place of an attack during your Attack action, grant another creature that can see or hear you within 30 ft. +{{leadership:modifier}} on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws until your next turn.

description.p: As an action, you can expend one Exploit Die to command another creature that can see or hear you within 30 feet to instantly make one weapon attack with advantage. On hit, it deals bonus damage equal to one roll of your Exploit Die.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die to grant another creature that can see or hear oyu within 30 ft. the ability to instantly make one weapon attack with advantage; on hit, it deals 1d{{exploit dice:size}} bonus damage.

description.p: As an action, you can expend one Exploit Die and choose another creature that can see or hear you within 30 feet. The creature can instantly move up to its speed toward a hostile creature and make one melee weapon attack against it.
On hit, it deals additional damage equal to one roll of your Exploit Die, and if the target is equal to its size or smaller, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall prone.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die to grant another creature that can see or hear oyu within 30 ft. the ability to instantly move up to its speed towards a hostile creature and make a weapon attack against it; on hit, it deals 1d{{exploit dice:size}} bonus damage, and if the target is smaller than it, the target must make a Strength saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}) or fall prone.

description.p: When you hit with a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend an Exploit Die to strike with great force, dealing additional damage equal to two rolls of your Exploit Die and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or suffer the effects below for 1 minute:

ul.li: Its speed is halved and it cannot take reactions.
Its Armor Class is reduced by 2.
It has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.
It cannot make more than one attack during its turn, even if a feature would allow it to make multiple.
It can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending these effects on a success.

description.p: This Exploit's effects do not stack with the slow spell.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, expend one Exploit Die to deal 2d{{exploit dice:size}} additional damage and force it to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}); if it fails, then for 1 minute its speed is halved, it cannot take reactions, its AC is reduced by 2, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it cannot make more than 1 attack per turn. it can make another Wisdom saving throw at the end of its turns to end this effect on a success; these effects do not stack with the slow spell.

description.p: As a bonus action, you can expend one Exploit Die to enter a heightened state of focus which you must concentrate on as if you were concentrating on a spell. For 1 minute, or until you lose concentration, you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Your speed is doubled.
You gain a +2 bonus to your Armor Class.
You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws.
You gain an additional action on each of your turns. It can only be used to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, Search, or Use an Object action.

description.p: When the effect ends, you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Exploit save DC, or you can't move or take actions until after the end of your next turn.
This Exploit's effects do not stack with the haste spell.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die to concentrate and enter a heightened state; your speed is doubled, you gain +2 AC, you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and you gain an additional action per turn to Attack (one waepon), Dash, Disengage, Hide, Search, or Use an Object; these effects do not stack with the haste spell. The effect ends after 1 minute or when you lose concentration, and you must succeed on a {{exploit dice:dc}} Constitution saving throw upon its ending or become unable to move or take actions until after the end of your next turn.

description.p: As a bonus action, you can expend Exploit Dice (up to your proficiency bonus) to enter a heightened state of physical performance which you must concentrate on as if you were concentrating on a spell. You gain the benefits listed below:

ul.li: Whenever you make a Strength or Constitution check, you can treat a roll of 9 or lower on the d20 as a 10.
Your walking speed increases by a number of feet equal to 5 times your Strength modifier (minimum of 5 feet).
You count as one size larger for the purposes of carrying capacity and the size of creatures that you can grapple.
Both your long and high jump distances double, even if that distance would exceed your remaining movement.

description.p: The effects last for 10 minutes for each Exploit Die spent as part of this Exploit, and end early if you are incapacitated.

sheet.description: Expend up to {{proficiency}} Exploit Dice to concentrate and enter a heightened state; when making Strength or Constitution checks you can treat rolls of 9 or lower as 10s, your walking speed increases by {{mythic athleticism speed}} ft., you count as 1 size larger for calculating carrying capacity and grappling ability, and your long and high jump distances double even if this would exceed your remaining movement. The state lasts 10 minutes per spent Exploit Die, and ends early if you are incapacitated.

description.p: When you take damage from a source you can see, you can expend Exploit Dice (up to your proficiency bonus) to reduce the incoming damage. For each Exploit Die you expend you roll three Exploit Dice, adding your Constitution modifier to the total of all the dice. You reduce the damage by the total.
If the total rolled exceeds the amount of damage, you gain temporary hit points equal to the remaining amount.

sheet.description: When you take damage from a visible source, expend up to {{proficiency}} Exploit Dice and reduce the damage by three times that many {{exploit dice:size}}, + {{consitution:modifier}}; if you would heal past full health, gain temporary hit points equal to the remainder.

description.p: In place of an attack, you can expend Exploit Dice (up to your proficiency bonus) and fire one piece of ammunition in a line, out to the weapon's normal range. Creatures in the line must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take piercing damage equal to two rolls of your Exploit Die for each Die you spent + either your Strength or Dexterity modifier and fall prone. On a success, they take half that damage and don't fall prone.

sheet.description: In place of an attack, expend up to {{proficiency}} Exploit Dice and fire a projectile to its normal range in a line; creatures in the path must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}); if they fail, they take 2d{{exploit dice:size}} per expended dice + {{thunderous shot prof}} and fall prone, or half that without falling prone on a success.

description.p: As an action, you can expend one Exploit Die and issue a mighty cry, forcing creatures of your choice that can hear you in an adjacent 30-foot cone to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they drop whatever they are holding and are frightened of you for 1 minute. If a frightened creature ends its turn and does not have line of sight to you, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Dice to force a creature that can hear you in an adjacent 30-ft. cone to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}); if they fail, they drop whatever they are holding and are frightened of you for 1 minute. If it ends its turn without line of sight to you, it can repeat the saving throw to end the effect on a success.

description.p: As a bonus action, you can expend an Exploit Die to increase your speed, if only temporarily. For the next minute, you can take the Dash action as a bonus action on each of your turns, including the bonus action you used to use this Exploit.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die to, for one minute, grant yourself the ability to take the Dash action as a bonus action each turn, including this turn.

description.p: As a reaction when a creature you can see within 30 feet is reduced to 0 hit points, you can expend one Exploit Die and move up to twice your walking speed, so long as you end the movement within 5 feet of the downed creature.

The creature can then expend one Hit Die to regain hit points equal to one Hit Die roll + its Constitution modifier. It also gains a number of temporary hit points equal to one roll of your Exploit Die for each opportunity attack you provoked as part of the movement granted to you by this Exploit.

sheet.description: When a creature you can see within 30 ft. is reduced to 0 hit points, expend one Exploit Die to move up to twice your walking speed in order to end the movement within 5 ft. of the downed creature. That creature can expend one Hit Die to regain hit points equal to that Hit Die roll + its Constitution modifier, as well as +1d{{exploit dice:size}} additional hit points for each opportunity attack you provoked in order to reach it this turn.

description.p: In place of an attack, you can expend Exploit Dice (up to your proficiency bonus) and strike the ground at your feet, forcing all creatures in an adjacent 20-foot cube to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take bludgeoning damage equal to two rolls of your Exploit Die for each Exploit Die you spent + your Strength modifier and are knocked prone. On a success, they take half as much damage and don't fall prone. Objects in this area take the maximum amount of damage.
Moreover, the area of the 20-foot cube becomes difficult terrain until a creature takes 1 minute to clear it.

sheet.description: In place of an attack, expend up to {{proficiency}} Exploit Dice to force all creatures within an adjacent 20-foot cube to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC {{exploit save:dc}}); if they fail, they take 2d{{exploit dice:size}} bludgeoning damage per Exploit Die spent + {{strength:modifier}} and are knocked prone, or half that without falling prone on a success. Objects take the full damage. This area becomes difficult terrain until a creatures takes 1 minute to clear it.

description.p: In place of an attack, you can expend Exploit Dice (up to your proficiency bonus) to rend the air in front of you with a melee weapon, forcing targets in an adjacent 20-foot cone to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, targets take slashing damage equal to two rolls of your Exploit Die for each Exploit Die spent + either your Strength or Dexterity modifier. On a successful save, targets take half as much damage.

sheet.description: In place of an attack, expend up to {{proficiency}} Exploit Dice to force all creatures within an adjacent 20-foot cone to make a Constitution saving throw (DC {{exploit save:dc}}); if they fail, they take 2d{{exploit dice:size}} slashing damage per Exploit Die spent + {{gale slash prof}}, or half that on a success.

description.p: You can expend an Exploit Die and spend 1 minute giving an inspirational speech to a number of creatures that can hear you equal to 1 + your Charisma modifier. At the end of this speech, targets gain temporary hit points equal to your level.
While the temporary hit points from this Exploit last, the creatures have advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Dice and spend 1 minute giving an inspirational speech to 1 + {{charisma:modifier}} creatures that can hear you to grant them {{level}} temporary hit points each.

description.p: You can expend an Exploit Die and spend 1 hour to recruit a humanoid Mercenary from a settlement you currently occupy. For this Exploit to work, there must be a willing humanoid, such as a bounty hunter, adventurer, or other sellsword in a settlement of significant size, as determined by the DM.

You choose to recruit a Brute or Scout, which determines certain traits in their stat block. They use the Mercenary stat block below and roll their own initiative in combat. On their turn, they do their best to follow any orders you have given. If not, they will defend themselves to the best of their ability.
The Mercenary remains in your service until you dismiss them, they abandon you, or they die. You do not regain the Exploit Die spent on this Exploit until they leave your service.
You can only have one Mercenary in your service at a time. Recruiting another causes others to abandon you.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Dice to recruit a humanoid Mercenary from a settlement you're in, either a Brute of a Scout. They remain in your service until you dismiss them, they abandon you, or they die; you do not regain the Exploit die while it is in your service, and you can only have one at a time.

description.p: A mercenary companion.
A mercenary companion.
The Mercenary has a number of d10 Hit Dice equal to your level. It also gains all the normal benefits of both short and long rests.

sheet.description: The Mercenary has a number of d10 Hit Dice equal to your level and gains all the normal benefits of both short and long rests.

description.p: If you fall to 0 hit points the Mercenary does everything in its power to flee and return home.

sheet.description: If you fall to 0 hit points the Mercenary does everything in its power to flee and return home.

description.p: The Mercenary can use a bonus action to attempt a Shove or Grapple.

sheet.description: The Mercenary can use a bonus action Shove or Grapple.

description.p: The Mercenary can use a bonus action to take the Disengage or Hide action.

sheet.description: The Mercenary can use a bonus action to Disengage or Hide.

description.p: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d8 +3 slashing damage.

sheet.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d8 +3 slashing damage.

sheet.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d6 +3 slashing damage.

description.p: Ranged Attack: +6 to hit, range 80/320, one target. Hit: 1d6 +3 piercing damage.

sheet.description: Ranged Attack: +6 to hit, range 80/320, one target. Hit: 1d6 +3 piercing damage.

Hit Points 6 + five times your level
Speed 0 ft.

Senses passive Perception 12

Shortbow (Scout). Ranged Attack: +6 to hit, range 80/320, one target. Hit: 1d6 +3 piercing damage.

description.p: You can expend an Exploit Die and spend 1 hour gathering information on up to 1 square mile of a wilderness that you currently occupy. At the end of the hour, you gain knowledge about three of the following as they relate to the area:

ul.li: Any settlements or camps with five or more occupants.
Prominent natural formations, bodies of water, and ruins.
Local plants, animals, weather, and ecosystems.
Powerful (CR 1 or higher) creatures that reside within, or have passed through the area within the last 24 hours.
Secret trails, entrances, groves, or monster lairs.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Dice and spend 1 hour gathering information on up to 1 sq. mi. of wilderness you are in; at the end of the hour, gain knowledge about three of the following: settlements or camps with at least five occupants; prominent natural formations, bodies of water, and ruins; local plants, animals, and weather; powerful creatures that reside in or have passed through in the last 24 hours; secret trails, groves, or monster lairs

description.p: You can expend an Exploit Die and spend 1 hour gathering information on up to 1 square mile of a settlement that you currently occupy. At the end of the hour, you gain knowledge about three of the following as they relate to the area:

ul.li: Any active factions and faction outposts within the area.
Powerful (CR 1 or higher) politicians or military leaders.
Loyalties, beliefs, rumors, and fears of the local populace.
Secret alleyways, doors, hideouts, or storefronts.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Dice and spend 1 hour gathering information on up to 1 sq. mi. of a settlement you are in; at the end of the hour, gain knowledge about three of the following: active factions in the area; powerful politicians or military leaders; local populace loyalties, beliefs, rumors, and fears; secret alleyways, doors, and hideouts

description.p: As a bonus action, you can expend one Exploit Die to signal your allies to fight as a pack. Until the end of your next turn, creatures of your choice that can see or hear you within 30 feet have advantage on attack rolls, so long as a conscious allied creature is within 5 feet of their target.
You can use a bonus action on your next turn to extend the Exploit's effects to the end of your turn after that, though you do not need to expend an Exploit Die when you do so.
You cannot maintain this Exploit longer than 1 minute.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die to grant advantage on attack rolls to creatures of your choice that can see or hear you within 30 ft., as long as a conscious allied creature is within 5 ft. of the attack target. You can use a Bonus action on your next turn to sustain the action without additional Exploit Dice, up to 1 minute.

description.p: As a bonus action, you can expend one Exploit Die to force a creature within 30 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it suffers the following effects for the next minute:

ul.li: It has advantage on any attack roll it makes against you, but it has disadvantage on all other attack rolls.
If it moves, it must end its movement closer to you.
Any creature that you target with an Inspiring Word or a Tactical Exploit has advantage on attack rolls against this creature until the beginning of your next turn.

description.p: The creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. This effect instantly ends if the creature cannot see or hear you.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die to force a creature within 30 ft. to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}); if it fails, for the next minute while it can see or hear you: it has advantage on attack rolls against you, but disadvantage on all other attack rolls; if it moves it must end its movement closer to you; creatures you target with an Inspiring Word or Tactical Exploit have advantage on attack rolls against this creature until the beginning of your next turn. The creature repats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effects on a success.

description.p: As an action on your turn, you can expend Exploit Dice (up to your proficiency bonus) and let forth an inspiring shout. A number of creatures equal to your Leadership modifier (minimum of 1) that can hear you within 30 feet regain a number of hit points equal to one roll of your Exploit Die for each Die you spent + your Leadership modifier.
If you target a living creature with 0 hit points, it doesn't need to hear you, but it does gain 1 level of exhaustion.

sheet.description: Expend up to {{proficiency}} Exploit Die to grant {{leadership:modifier}} creatures that can hear you within 30 ft. a number of hit points equal to 1d{{exploit dice:size}} per expended Exploit Die + {{leadership:modifier}}.

description.p: As an action, you can expend one Exploit Die and dictate a strategic course of action to a number of creatures equal to your Leadership modifier (minimum of 1) within 30 feet that can see or hear you. Creatures can use their reaction to move up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die and allow {{leadership:modifier}} creatures that can see or hear you within 30 ft. to use their reactions to move up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks..

description.p: As an action, you can expend one Exploit Die to focus your mind and temporarily sharpen one of your skills. Choose a skill or tool that you are proficient in. For the next hour, you can add one roll of your Exploit Die to any check you make that uses that skill, without expending an Exploit Die.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Dice and choose a skill or tool you are proficient in; you can add 1d{{exploit dice:size}} to checks with that skill or tool (the rolled dice are not expended).

description.p: As a bonus action, you can expend one Exploit Die to enter a heightened state of movement which you must concentrate on as if you were concentrating on a spell. For 1 minute, or until you lose concentration, you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Your movement is unaffected by difficult terrain.
You can use a bonus action on your turn to gain the benefits of both the Dash and Disengage action.
Spells and other magical effects can neither reduce your speed nor cause you to be paralyzed or restrained.
You can spend 5 feet of movement to instantly escape from nonmagical restraints like manacles or a grapple.
Swimming or being underwater imposes no penalties on your movements or your attack rolls.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Dice and enter a heightened state with concentration, lasting for 1 minute or until you lose concentration. You gain the following: your movement is unaffected by difficult terrain; you can use your bonus action to both Dash and Disengage; spells and magical effects cannot reduce your speed, paralyze, or restrain you; you can spend 5 ft. of movement to instantly escape nonmagical restraints; swimming or being underwater imposes no penalty for your attack rolls.

description.p: As a bonus action, you can expend one Exploit Die and enter into a heightened state of focus which you must concentrate on as if concentrating on a spell. For the next minute, or until you lose concentration, you can use a bonus action, including the bonus action you used to use this Exploit to make two ranged weapon attacks so long as you have ammunition.
This Exploit's effects don't stack with the swift quiver spell.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Dice and enter a heightened state with concentration, lasting for 1 minute or until you lose concentration. In this state, you can use a bonus action (including the one used for this Exploit) to make two ranged weapon attacks if you have the ammunition. This does not stack with the swift quiver spell.

description.p: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one Exploit Die to strike with near-supernatural power, dealing additional damage equal to three rolls of your Exploit Die. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or for the next minute it has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls and can't take reactions.
The creature can make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending these effects on a success.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, expend one Exploit Dice to deal an additional 3d{{exploit dice:size}} damage and force it to make a Wisdom saving throw; if it fails, for the next minute it has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls, and can't take reactions. It repeats the saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

description.p: When you take damage that would reduce you to 0 hit points, even if that damage would kill you outright, you can expend Exploit Dice (up to your proficiency bonus) and fall to 1 hit point. For each Exploit Die you spent, you roll three Exploit Dice, and you gain temporary hit points equal to the total roll.

sheet.description: When you would take damage that would reduce you to 0 hit points or kill you outright, expend up to {{proficiency}} Exploit Dice to return to 1 hit point; roll 3 {{exploit dice:size}}s for each expended hit die and gain that many temporary hit points.

description.p: As an action on your turn, you can expend Exploit Dice (up to your proficiency bonus) and instantly strike with a melee weapon you are holding at a number of creatures within 30 feet equal to 1 + the number of dice expended, forcing them to make a Dexterity saving throw. Creatures take damage of your weapon's type equal to two rolls of your Exploit Die + your Dexterity modifier on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful save.
For each of the creatures reduced to 0 hit points by this Exploit, you can force another creature of your choice within range of this Exploit to make the Dexterity saving throw.
Once the Exploit ends, you appear in an unoccupied space of your choice next to one of the targets of this Exploit.

sheet.description: Expend up to {{proficiency}} Exploit Dice and instantly strike with a held melee weapon at (1 + the number of expended dice) creatures within 30 ft, forcing them to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}); if they fail, they take 2d{{exploit dice:size}} + {{dexterity:modifier}} damage in your weapon's type, and half that on a save. Then, you appear in an unoccupied space next to one of the targets.

description.p: You can expend one Exploit Die and spend 1 hour training a number of humanoid creatures equal to your level to fight. Creatures that spend the full hour listening and training with you gain two of the following benefits of your choice:

ul.li: They gain proficiency with one martial weapon.
They gain proficiency with light armor and shields.
They gain temporary hit points equal to your level.
They gain proficiency in one of the following skills: Animal Handling, Athletics, Medicine, Survival, or Stealth.
They have advantage on saving throws to resist being charmed or frightened.

description.p: The benefits you choose for these creatures last until they are incapacitated, or until the end of their next long rest.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die and spend 1 hour training up to {{level}} creatures, granting them two of the following benefits until they are incapacitated or take a long rest: proficiency with a martial weapon; proficiency with light armor and shields; {{level}} temporary hit points; proficiency in Animal Handling, Ahtletics, Medicine, Survival, or Stealth; advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

description.p: In place of an attack, you can expend an Exploit Die to strike a creation of magical force, such as a prismatic wall, resilient sphere, or forcecage with a melee weapon you are wielding. Any magical creations created with a spell slot of 3rd-level or lower are instantly destroyed by your strike.

If the magical creation was created with a spell of 4th-level or higher, make a Strength check. The DC equals 10 + the level of the spell slot used to create it. On a successful check, the magical creation is instantly destroyed by your strike.

sheet.description: In place of an attack, expend one Exploit Die to strike a forcecage, resilient sphere, or other creation of force with a melee weapon. If it was created by a 3rd-level spell or lower it is destroyed; if created by a 4th-level or higher spell, make a Strength check (DC 10 + level of the creating spell's slot); if successful, it is destroyed.

description.p: When you take the Attack action, you can issue this Order in place of an attack, targeting another creature that can see or hear you within 30 feet. Until the start of your next turn, that creature has advantage on every attack roll, ability check, and saving throw it makes and is resistant to all damage.

sheet.description: In place of an attack during your Attack action, grant another creature that can see or hear you within 30 ft. advantage on every attack roll, ability check, and saving throw, as well as resistance to all damage, until your next turn.

description.p: When you take the Attack action, you can issue this Order in place of an attack, targeting a creature within 30 feet that has died within the last minute. It regains hit points equal to your level + your Leadership modifier and can stand up.
This Tactical Exploit cannot return a creature to life that has died of old age, nor can it restore missing body parts.

sheet.description: In place of an attack during your Attack action, target another creature within 30 ft. that has died within the last minute; it regains {{revitalizing order hp}} hit points. This cannot return a creature that has died of old age back to life or restore missing body parts.

description.p: As an action, you expend one Exploit Die and drive an ally to fight as never before. Another creature of your choice within 30 feet that can see or hear you can use its reaction to move up to its full speed and take a single action or bonus action.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die to grant another creature that can see or hear you within 30 ft. the ability to use its reaction to move up to its full speed and take a single action or bonus action.

description.p: As an action on your turn, you can expend Exploit Dice (up to your proficiency bonus) to fire a volley of ammunition at a point you can see within the range of your weapon. Creatures of your choice within 30 feet of that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or they take piercing damage equal to two rolls of your Exploit Die for each Exploit Die you spent + your Dexterity modifier. Any creature that succeeds on its saving throw takes half as much piercing damage.
You must have enough ammunition to hit each target.

sheet.description: Expend up to {{proficiency}} Exploit Dice and choose a visible point within your weapon range. Creatureswithin 30 ft. of the point must makea Dexterity saving throw (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}); if they fai,l, they take 2d{{exploit dice:size}} +{{dexterity:modifier}} piercing damage, or half that on a success.

description.p: As an action on your turn, you can expend Exploit Dice (up to your proficiency bonus) and flourish a melee weapon then vanish. Choose up to five targets that you can see within 30 feet and make one melee weapon attack against each one.
On a hit, each target takes damage of your weapon's type equal to two rolls of your Exploit Die for each Exploit Die you spent + either your Strength or Dexterity modifier.
You then appear in an unoccupied space of your choice you can see within 5 feet of one of the targets of this Exploit.

sheet.description: Expend up to {{proficiency}} Exploit Dice and choose up to 5 visible targets within 30 ft., making a melee weapon attack against each. On a hit each takes 2d{{exploit dice:size}} per spent Exploit Die + {{steel wind slash prof}} damage in your weapon's type. You then appear in an unoccupied space within 5 ft. of a target.

description.p: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend an Exploit Die to strike with legendary power, dealing bonus force damage equal to four rolls of your Exploit Die. It must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, or be shunted to a harmless demiplane where it is incapacitated. At the start of your next turn it reappears in the unoccupied space nearest to the last space it occupied when you hit it with this attack.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, expend an Exploit Die to deal 4d{{exploit dice:size}} bonus force damage and force it to make a Charisma saving throw; if it fails, it is shunted to a harmless demiplane and incapacitated until the start of your next turn, where it returns to the nearest unoccupied space.

description.p: As an action on your turn, you can expend Exploit Dice (up to your proficiency bonus) to strike the ground with mythic power. A shockwave of thunderous force erupts from you, forcing all creatures within 30 feet to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, they take bludgeoning damage equal to two rolls of your Exploit Die for each Exploit Die you spent + your Strength modifier and are knocked prone, and on a success, they take half as much damage and don't fall prone. Objects in this area take maximum damage.
The area becomes difficult terrain, and a creature can use its action to clear one 5-foot square of this difficult terrain.

sheet.description: Expend up to {{exploit dice:proficiency}} Hit Die toforce creatures within 30 ft. to make Constitution saving throws (DC {{exploit dice:dc}}); if they fail, they take 2d{{exploit dice:size}} bludgeoning damage per Exploit Die expended and fall prone, or half that without falling prone on a success. Objects take maximum damage. After this is used, the area becomes difficult terrain, and a creature can use its action to clear a 5-foot square of it.

description.p: As a bonus action, you can expend one Exploit Die to enter a legendary state of focus which you must concentrate on as if you were concentrating on a spell. For 1 minute, or until you lose concentration, you gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You gain 50 temporary hit points. If any of these remain when the effects of this Exploit end, they are lost.
You have advantage on any weapon attack you make.
Once per turn when you hit with a weapon attack, you deal bonus damage equal to one roll of your Exploit Die.
You gain a bonus to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws equal to one roll of your Exploit Die.
When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can make one additional weapon attack as part of that action.

description.p: When the effect ends, you can’t move or take actions until after your next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over you. This Exploit doesn't stack with tenser's transformation.

sheet.description: Expend one Hit Die to enter a focused state with concentration for 1 minute or until you lose concentration, gaining the following: 50 temporary hit points until you leave the state; advantage on all weapon attacks; 1d{{exploit dice:size}} bonus damage on a weapon attack once per turn; +1d{{exploit dice:size}} to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws; you can make an additional attack as part of your Attack action. Once this state ends you cannot move or take actions until after your next turn. This Exploit does not stack with the tenser's transformation spell.

description.p: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one Exploit Die to strike with legendary force, dealing additional damage equal to four rolls of your Exploit Die.
If the damage of this Exploit reduces the target's remaining hit points to 50 or fewer, you cut off one of the its heads. If the creature cannot survive without the lost head, it is killed.
Creatures can use a Legendary Resistance to avoid being beheaded. Any creatures that don't have or don't need a head are immune to this Exploit's effects, but still take the damage.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, expend one Exploit Die to deal 4d{{exploit dice:size}} additional damage. If this reduces the target's health to 50 or fewer hit points, you behead it, and if it cannot survive in this state then it dies. Creatures can use a Legendary Resistance to avoid the beheading.

description.p: At the end of a long rest, you can expend one of your Exploit Dice to put an undisclosed contingency plan into place. Until you activate this Exploit again you cannot regain this Exploit Die. You can only have one contingency plan at a time.

As an action, you can reveal your previously undisclosed plan (which you make up at the time of its reveal) and make a DC 20 Intelligence check. You may add a skill the DM deems appropriate to your plan. On a success, your secret plans and preparations take effect perfectly as you described them.
The cost to execute your plan cannot exceed the equivalent of 5,000 gp, and the effects cannot exceed a 7th-level spell.
For example, you may reveal that you secretly purchased the perfect spell scroll last time you were in a town, or that you paid a mercenary band or airship to come to your rescue

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die at the end of a long rest to implement a secret contingency plan; it remains expended until the plan resolves. As a later action, make a DC 20 Intelligence check, and if successful, the plan takes effect; it grants an effect of your choice that cannot exceed the equivalent of 5,000 gp or a 7th-level spell.

description.p: As an action you expend one Exploit Die and order your allies to strike at a foe of your choice. Creatures of your choice (up your Leadership modifier) within 30 feet that can see or hear you can immediately take the Attack action (including Extra Attacks), or cast a spell of 5th-level or lower with a casting time of one action. All attacks and spells much target the foe that you designate when you use this Exploits.

sheet.description: Expend one Exploit Die to grant {{leadership:modifier}} creatures of your choice within 30 ft. that can see or hear you the immediate ability to take the Attack action (including Extra Attacks), or cast a 5th-level or lower spell with a casting time of one action; they must all target a foe designated by you.
